comments.body: Out of sheer curiosity: why not markdown?

I can't remember exactly, but I think it's because Markdown requires column labels, we could do something like:

| Summary                    |     |
| -------------------------- | --- |
| Commits since last release | 174 |
| Merged PRs                 | 55  |
| Contributors               | 9   |
| Closed issues              | 13  |
| New features               | 3   |

but not:

| Commits since last release | 174 |
| Merged PRs                 | 55  |
| Contributors               | 9   |
| Closed issues              | 13  |
| New features               | 3   |

Is it maybe also worth putting in a reminder that in order for these the work, ensure you have code lenses enabled in your client? I'm not sure if they are for vscode, but for example they aren't be default in coc.nvim.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +66,70 @@the `metals.superMethodLensesEnabled` configuration option - they are enabled by
default. For example in Visual Studio Code:

![Screenshot 2020-03-09 at 16 24 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10478402/76293133-cbbabb00-62b0-11ea-84be-06c992af768b.png)
